info.title: kronup / api
info.description:
# API reference

The kronup API follows [REST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer) guidelines. All responses are [JSON-encoded](http://www.json.org/), with standard HTTP response codes and verbs.

# Frameworks

You can start building your kronup application today with our [PHP SDK](https://kronup.github.io/kronup-php/).

# Authorization

Our API uses a [JSON Web Token](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON_Web_Token) for authentication. 

You can get your token form the settings page.

```
$ curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR.JWT.KEY"
```

# Errors

Conventional HTTP response codes are used to indicate the status of an API request.

| HTTP Status Codes |  |
|---|---|
| 400 - Bad Request | Invalid request, ususally due to a missing argument |
| 401 - Unauthorized | Authorization error due to invalid, expired or missing token |
| 402 - Request Failed | Payment required |
| 403 - Forbidden | You are not allowed to perform that request |
| 404 - Not Found | Resource does not exist |
| 409 - Conflict | This request is in conflict with another |
| 429 - Too Many Requests | You are sending too many requests to our API servers |
| 5xx - Server Errors | Something went wrong with kronup's servers |

## 401 Unauthorized

For status code `401 - Unauthorized` you can receive one of the following errors:

| Error ID | Error Message |
|---|---|
| jwt-missing | Authentication token missing |
| jwt-format | Invalid JWT token |
| jwt-format-header | Invalid JWT header |
| jwt-format-body | Invalid JWT body |
| jwt-payload | Invalid JWT payload |
| jwt-issuer | Invalid JWT issuer |
| jwt-public-key | Could not fetch JWT public key |
| auth-missing | Authorization header missing |
| auth-invalid | Wrong authorization strategy |
| auth-api-invalid | API user does not exist |
| auth-api-expired | API token is no longer valid |

tags.name: Account
tags.description:
Manage the current account.

These methods apply to the identity declared in the authorization bearer token.

Each Account and Service Account can send at most **10000** requests per day through our API.

Each [User](#tag/Users) can receive at most **100** Notifications for each [Organization](#tag/Organizations) they are a part of.

tags.name: Users
tags.description:
Manage users within the scope of an [Organization](#tag/Organizations).

There are 3 site-level roles: **admin**, **moderator** and **user**.

Admins and moderators have access to account data outside of their organization (read as **A can B**):


|  | B: admin | B: moderator | B: user |
|---|---|---|---|
| A: admin | read/write | read/write | read/write |
| A: moderator | read | read/write | read/write |
| A: user | - | - | - |


There are 3 organization-level roles: **owner**, **manager** and **member**.

Within the same organization, account actions are limited (read as **A can B**):


|  | B: owner | B: manager | B: member |
|---|---|---|---|
| A: owner | read/write | read/write | read/write |
| A: manager | read | read/write | read/write |
| A: member | read | read | read |



* Any account has **read/write** permissions over **itself**
* Site-level roles have priority over organization-level roles for **write** rules
* Organization-level roles have priority over site-level roles for **read** rules

tags.name: Invitations
tags.description:
Invitations follow the [Organization](#tag/Organizations) role-based access control rules.

Each organization can have a maximum of **250** invitations.

tags.name: Organizations
tags.description:
Each [Account](#tag/Account) owns at most **50** Organizations.

These are the role-based access control rules for organizations:

| Organization Role \ Action | Read * | Write * | Delete ** |
|---|---|---|---|
| Owner | yes | yes | yes |
| Manager | yes | yes | no |
| Member | yes | no | no |


(*) The **read** and **write** actions refer to all endpoints that require the **x-org-id** header.

(**) The **delete** action refers to removing the Organization model.

tags.name: Teams
tags.description: Each [Organization](#tag/Organizations) has at least **1** and at most **100** Teams.

tags.name: Channels
tags.description: Each [Team](#tag/Teams) has at least **1** and at most **100** Channels.

tags.name: Value items
tags.description:
Instead of `issues`, we're using `value items` to emphasise that everything must be viewed through the lens of customer value.

Value items are debated and advanced in [Channels](#tag/Channels). 

Each `value item` has length restrictions to encourage brevity and to ensure that all team members are well-informed quickly.

In order to prevent information overload, each [Channel](#tag/Channels) can hold at most **50** 'value items'.

tags.name: Assumptions
tags.description:
Each [Value item](#tag/Value-items) has at least **1** and at most **100** Assumptions.

Less is more, so focus on having smaller value items with fewer assumptions per item.

Assumptions need to be validated by running new experiments or by relying on past results.

tags.name: Tasks
tags.description:
Each [Value item](#tag/Value-items) has at least **1** and at most **100** Tasks.
        
Use divide-et-impera as often as you like, but preferably keep you value items as short as possible.

All tasks must be marked as done before the value item can be retired to deep context.

Each task can have a maximum of **10** [Notions](#tag/Notions), **100** discoveries, and **250** feedback items.

tags.name: Notions
tags.description:
Each [Task](#tag/Tasks) can be described with a list of Notions.
        
Notions are products, services, tools, methodologies or skills required to successfully complete a task.

Each [Organization](#tag/Organizations) can define at most **100000** Notions.

tags.name: Experiences
tags.description:
Team members can anonymously assess their own and their peer's proficiency with each each [Notion](#tag/Notions).

The evaluation of notions will be used to determine task assignments in order to maximize productivity and team happiness.

tags.name: Deep Context
tags.description:
Once all [Tasks](#tag/Tasks) are marked as done, [Value items](#tag/Value-items) can be advanced further to Deep Context.
        
Once in Deep Context, Value items can no longer be modified or restored to an active state.

get.description: Retrieve the current account model

schema.title: Payload Account Update
schema.description: Payload object required to update an Account

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.kronup.com/v1/account \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"userName":"John Doe"}'

delete.description: Delete the current account. This action is reversible only if you sign back in within 14 days. API calls and service accounts cannot restore deleted accounts.

get.description: Get a list of notification models
Retrieve value item model

delete.description: Delete a value item from Deep Context";

get.description: Get a list of value item models
Retrieve experience model for specified Notion
Retrieve all experience models for this user

put.description: Anonymously evaluate another user on this notion

post.description: Create a new invitation to this organization

schema.title: Payload Invitation Create
schema.description: Payload object required to create an Invitation

inviteDomain.description: User email domain name. If specified, restrict access to e-mail addresses belonging to this domain.

inviteExpireDays.description: The invitation expires after this many days. 0 = no expiration

inviteUsesMax.description: The invitation expires after being used this many times. 0 = no expiration

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.kronup.com/v1/invitations \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'x-org-id: org-id-***' \
  --data '{"inviteName":"string","inviteDomain":"","inviteOrgRole":"member","inviteExpireDays":5,"inviteUsesMax":10}'

get.description: Get a list of invitation models
Retrieve invitation model

schema.title: Payload Invitation Update
schema.description: Payload object required to update an Invitation

inviteDomain.description: User email domain name. If specified, restrict access to e-mail addresses belonging to this domain.

inviteExpireDays.description: The invitation expires after this many days. 0 = no expiration

inviteUsesMax.description: The invitation expires after being used this many times. 0 = no expiration

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url 'https://api.kronup.com/v1/invitations/invitation-id-***' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'x-org-id: org-id-***' \
  --data '{"inviteName":"string","inviteDomain":"","inviteOrgRole":"member","inviteExpireDays":5,"inviteUsesMax":10}'

schema.description: Payload object required to create a Value Item

  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'x-org-id: org-id-***' \
  --data '{"digest":"Feature name","details":"Feature description","type":"feature","priority":"must"}'

  --header 'x-org-id: org-id-***' \
  --data '{"confirmed":true,"digest":"string","details":"string","state":"idle"}'

canAdvance.description:
Conditions for Value Items to advance to the next stage:

  * `planning` - at least 1 Assumption was added
  * `validation` - all Assumption experiments were marked as `done`
  * `execution` - all Tasks were marked as `done`
  * `deep context` - Value Items become read-only; they can only be deleted by an Organization manager or administrator

digest.description:
Assumptions are formulated as simple statements that can be proven true or false; avoid questions and opinions.

>  What are the features?
> 
>  Does this feature exist?
> 
>  I don't like this feature.
> 
>  This feature exists.
Experiment findings formulated in one sentence
digest.example: Tested latest version successfully with a virtual machine

canAdvance.description:
Conditions for Value Items to advance to the next stage:

  * `planning` - at least 1 Assumption was added
  * `validation` - all Assumption experiments were marked as `done`
  * `execution` - all Tasks were marked as `done`
  * `deep context` - Value Items become read-only; they can only be deleted by an Organization manager or administrator

items.title: Minute Discovery
items.description: Task discovery recorded in an iteration

items.title: Minute Feedback
items.description: Task feedback recorded in an iteration
